title: What if balancing the game around marksmen getting 5 damage items is the real problem?
body:
And not high burst champs being able to kill glass cannons?

The game is being shifted to give "counter play" but in reality the counter play is there but it is against what is "standard" to do. Most fighters build for the situation which includes both tank and damage items as options. Why should this concept of building for the situation not apply to marksmen to a greater extent?

What happens when marksmen are considered as doing too much damage to do anything about? It might be a long shot for anyone to admit that now but it could in theory easily happen if this path being taken is followed long enough. Removing/reducing play styles that contend with squishy champs fairly easily seems like it could develop it's own issues.

replies.body:
What happens is you propose to weaken the ranged champions and strengthen the melees across the bord, so there is actually compensation for picking a champion with less range, only to be downvoted to kingdom come. 


Now we're working on increasing the period of time it takes to burst people as assassins, aka making them have dps and not burst. Thus, marksmen are going to be dominating season 7 for the most part. Wait... they've been doing that since season 2. It's only been straight nerfs for melee since then.

If an ADC gets caught out by an assassin, they deserve and NEED to be and SHOULD be deleted near instantly. Saying that means there's no counterplay is horseshit. Said ADC shouldn't have been wandering out alone by themselves then.

There also is a chance to avoid most assassins even after said point, it just takes ridiculously fast reflexes and/or extremely good luck, as it should. For instance, immediately Zhonya's-ing when Zed tries to ult you, flashing away instantly the moment Fizz goes into his E animation, immediately dropping a pink the moment Rengar ults (current old Rengar), so on and so forth.

If an ADC dies to an assassin when they weren't with their team, it is 100% their fault and they deserved to die. It's understandable if the team didn't successfully help peel or if the assassin successfully weaved his way through a team, but dying in a 1v1 in less than a second instantly is perfectly normal, and it should have stayed like that.

Game Knowledge should not be the only solution to an Assassin. For such a "High Mechanics" based class, they sure are lacking in the opponents ability to mechanically outplay them. The Assassin Update is fixing this by making Assassins still _burst very quickly_, but _making their burst telegraphed_. In compensation, when the Assassin correctly sets up his kills he is stronger for it. Current Assassins are dumpstered for the most part because _they are not fun to play against_. There is no joy in being one shot without time to react, or feeling helpless just because there's an Assassin in the game. The changes will be inherently better than current Assassins after the balancing dust settles.

You know what else isn't fun to play against?

Marksmen that just right-click you to death from range and Mages that stun you and then delete you before the stun even runs out.

You say it "felt bad" when Leblanc and Talon killed you while you were silenced. At least you can still move while silenced. If Veigar stuns you, Lux roots you, or Ahri charms you, then you can't even do that much as they kill you.

What is my counter-play option for Caitlyn right-clicking me from farther away than I can fight back? *Why do I even have to let her "outplay" me after I eat her auto-attacks to finally get close enough to jump onto her*? She crits me for half my health with targeted damage before I can even fight back and then I have to give her the chance to negate half my burst once I finally reach her?

I'm fine with assassins being mechanically difficult, and I'm fine with allowing for some counterplay, but can we force Marksmen to give us counterplay options too? Or, like, cut their damage in half so every melee champ doesn't need to build half-tank just to function?

If you don't think melee champions are at all compensated for being melee, Try dueling one as a ranged champion in melee range and see how much stronger they are. And the descrapancy isn't that bad. You just have to play with discipline.

The issue is its so hard for a lot of melee champs to actually get in melee range before they are critted so hard they have 3 extra buttholes. When Cait can drop traps for days, which give her obscene range on a guaranteed crit, and use her net, which repositions her and does the same to an enemy it hits, or when Ezreal Q (which applies on-hits, effectivly adding 200% AD if its a Trin or 100% AD and a slow if its IBG) is on a 1 sec cd lategame, or when Lucian can shred your armor with his ult that you HAVE to walk through to get to him and has a dash on ridiculously low cd, or when MF can hit you from behind your wave, chunking you for half your health and her ult, (which is an AOE cone) and does a minimum of 75% AD and 20% AP, can CRIT YOU FOR EACH OF 16 WAVES, not even to mention Jhin who can snipe you from 4 miles away with a 4th shot which, ult or no, IS GUARANTEED TO BE AN EXECUTING CRIT, I would say that ranged champs have a significant advantage.

And none of this matters if a strong melee champ gets a good flank on them. They get eaten alive. The pressure is just on the melee champs to make the plays. On the flip side they have an easier time doing so, since they're often given more tools and can more often afford to end up slightly out of position so they can play more "risky"

Marksmen SHOULD be forced to go with a defensive item or two that AREN'T offensive items like {{item:3156}} {{item:3139}} {{item:3053}}, etc when melee can kill them. That's supposed to be why items like Frozen Mallet exist.

_______

Let's also consider the fact that Riot doesn't feel like tanks should have to peel for their carries anymore. That's another big issue. Carries should not be able to 1v1 anything that gets onto them. That's how ranged vs melee ends up balanced. In any. Other. Game. Otherwise, there's no reason to be a melee even slightly focused on damage.

Another issue is that many, MANY tank/defensive that were made exclusively for tanky champs (or designed to be taken by tanky champs) have been repeatedly nerfed, Frozen Heart, Randuin's Omen and Sterak's Gage. All items meant for tanky dudes, all nerfed to hell. Not to the point of worthlessness but hardly the items they once were.

Let's not forget the reason why Sterak's was nerfed...oh right! Because AD Carries were abusing the shit out of it and using it more than it's intended buyers (Juggernauts originally). And you know what? They could have easily avoided having to nerf the item so hard if they just did what countless people suggested, make it fucking **melee only**! Bit like IBG being problematic, coulda been solved by making it melee only.

Thing is I know exactly what Riot's response would be:
 "Oh no we couldn't make it melee only, that would restrict build paths and stifle diversity. No no instead, we'll just nerf the item so that everyone can still build it, but it'll be totally subpar everywhere, especially on those who are **supposed **to build it"

You might be onto something here...

All the way back, before S3, Marksman were actually balanced around going for four offensive items ({{item:3072}}, {{item:3046}} / {{item:3078}}, {{item:3031}}, {{item:3035}} ) + 1 defensive item ({{item:3102}} or {{item:3026}} or {{item:3140}} - which had no upgrade back then). There was no real variety in their stuff, but it was rather balanced in the context of that game situation, as tanks also had stronger items (-20% AS aura on 99 Armor Frozen Heart, 20% chance for -35% AS and MS on Randuin's, 920-1370 HP Warmog's)...

The game really was in a much healthier place back then. RIP force of nature. RIP true tanks, what we have now are suicidal initiators (it's not the tank's fault it's their items being gutted while ADC items are buffed).
I wouldn't say that the game was in a healthier place back then, overall. But the ADC/tank situation and their respective items were, imo, better.
